author: Matthew J Hart

review: I received the refurbished one today. The cable (included was defective). So I bought a new cable (usb) at the office supply store ($10). I could have bought a brand new Roku for almost the same dollars I have spent on the refurb version + the usb cable. I bought a brand new Roku Stick in May. I was thrilled with it. So I bought the refurb for the bedroom tv (so I wouldn't have to move the other one back and forth). The refurb seems like it's a previous model. doesn't seem as fast to load and the remote is a bit different.also, the picture quality doesn't seem as good as the new one i purchased. if it continues to function properly,  i am giving it an "OK" rating (3 star). The new one I purchased would get the 5 star rating!  I am satisfied enough that i purchased the new cable (usb) just so I wouldn't have to send it back. However if I had read a review such as the one i am writing, i would opt to purchase a new one for $48. However, chances are, your refurb would work well and the cable would not be defective. I love the roku devices in general, however like all electronic companies they have some duds in the batch. And this one was clearly marked refurbished. I usually have great luck with refurbished items. This wasn't a bust, just not as perfect as the new one. I would recommend, just note what i have written above.
author: Bad Mackrel

review: Started a bit rough, you have to set up an account, another account among the million I already have.  Then they want your credit card!!  Took me half hour on hold to get all the reasons I should put a CC on account.  Finally got the no CC link from customer support.It started to look worth it for a bit, lots of apps and when it plays HD video it is WAY better than the TV's default apps.The problem is it won't play for very long.  We have yet to get Netflix to actually play.  The stick reboots all the time, like literally every time in the Netflix app and we have gotten nothing to play.  Hulu plays pretty well, but eventually the stick just starts rebooting, checking shows how hot it is at that point.  Youtube plays well, the GF is liking Crackle and some others.  If the Netflix thing is persistent this is going back.
author: sablesurfer

review: I really like the ability to be able to stream. But I have had to return the remote two times. Now using the 3rd one, and still have to remove the batteries sometimes to get it to work.
